# Community & Support

> [Home](../README.md) > **Community**

Join the CELLM community and learn how you can contribute.

---

## Why CELLM is Free Forever

**Because great tools should be accessible to everyone.**

We're developers too, and we've benefited from amazing open-source tools throughout our careers. CELLM is our way of giving back.

### Our Values

üåç **Community Over Profit**
- Built by developers, for developers
- No premium tiers or paywalls
- Features based on community needs
- Transparent development process

üìñ **Transparency**
- All code is open source
- No black boxes or hidden behavior
- Public roadmap and decision-making
- Clear documentation

ü§ù **Collaboration**
- Better together than apart
- Welcome contributions from everyone
- Shared ownership of success
- Respectful and inclusive community

üéÅ **Giving Back**
- Free forever, MIT licensed
- Use commercially without restrictions
- Modify and share freely
- No vendor lock-in

---

## No Catch, Really

**Common Questions:**

**Q: What's the business model?**
A: There isn't one. This is a passion project, not a startup.

**Q: Will there be a paid "Pro" version?**
A: No. Everything is and will remain free.

**Q: What about "Enterprise Edition"?**
A: Nope. MIT license means use it however you want.

**Q: How is development funded?**
A: Personal time and passion for great developer tools.

**Q: Can I use this commercially?**
A: Yes! MIT license allows commercial use without restrictions.

---

## How to Give Back

### 1. Star Us on GitHub

Simple but meaningful - helps others discover CELLM.

‚≠ê [Star CELLM](https://github.com/murillodutt/cellm)

### 2. Report Issues

Found a bug? Let us know!

- Be specific about the problem
- Include reproduction steps
- Share your environment details
- Screenshots are helpful

üêõ [Report Issue](https://github.com/murillodutt/cellm/issues/new)

### 3. Suggest Features

Have an idea for improvement?

- Describe the use case clearly
- Explain why it would be valuable
- Consider how it fits the project scope
- Be open to discussion

üí° [Suggest Feature](https://github.com/murillodutt/cellm/discussions/new?category=ideas)

### 4. Help Others

Answer questions in discussions, share your experiences, and help newcomers.

üí¨ [Join Discussions](https://github.com/murillodutt/cellm/discussions)

### 5. Contribute Code

See [Contributing Guide](../CONTRIBUTING.md) for details.

### 6. Share Your Story

Blog about CELLM, tweet about it, tell your colleagues.

Your experience helps others discover and trust the project.

### 7. Improve Documentation

- Fix typos
- Clarify confusing sections
- Add examples
- Translate documentation

Every improvement helps!

## Getting Help

### GitHub Discussions

**Best for:** Questions, ideas, general discussion

[üí¨ Start a Discussion](https://github.com/murillodutt/cellm/discussions)

**Categories:**
- **Q&A** - Ask questions, get help
- **Ideas** - Feature suggestions
- **Show and Tell** - Share your projects
- **General** - Everything else

### GitHub Issues

**Best for:** Bug reports, specific problems

[üêõ Open an Issue](https://github.com/murillodutt/cellm/issues)

**When to use:**
- Reproducible bugs
- Installation problems
- Error messages
- Feature requests (technical)

### Documentation

**Best for:** Self-service help

- [Installation Guide](./INSTALLATION.md)
- [Features Overview](./FEATURES.md)
- [Technical Specs](./TECHNICAL-SPECS.md)
- [Troubleshooting](./INSTALLATION.md#troubleshooting)

---

## Contributing

We welcome contributions! Here's how to get started:

### Quick Contributions

**No coding required:**
- Report bugs
- Suggest features
- Improve documentation
- Help others in discussions

### Code Contributions

**For developers:**

1. **Fork the repository**
   ```bash
   gh repo fork murillodutt/cellm
   ```

2. **Clone your fork**
   ```bash
   git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/cellm.git
   cd cellm
   ```

3. **Create a branch**
   ```bash
   git checkout -b feature/your-feature-name
   ```

4. **Make changes**
   - Follow existing code style
   - Add tests for new features
   - Update documentation

5. **Test your changes**
   ```bash
   bun test
   bun run lint
   ```

6. **Commit with clear message**
   ```bash
   git commit -m "feat: add your feature description"
   ```

7. **Push and create PR**
   ```bash
   git push origin feature/your-feature-name
   gh pr create
   ```

### Contribution Guidelines

**Code Quality:**
- Follow TypeScript best practices
- Write tests for new features
- Keep functions small and focused
- Document public APIs

**Commit Messages:**
```
<type>(<scope>): <description>

Examples:
feat(skills): add Prisma skill
fix(oracle): resolve search timeout
docs: update installation guide
test(agents): add architect agent tests
```

**Pull Request Process:**
1. Ensure tests pass
2. Update documentation
3. Describe changes clearly
4. Link related issues
5. Be responsive to feedback

See [CONTRIBUTING.md](../CONTRIBUTING.md) for full guidelines.

### Contributors

- Major feature contributions
- Significant bug fixes

## Community Guidelines

### Code of Conduct

**Our Pledge:**

We are committed to providing a welcoming and inclusive environment for everyone, regardless of:
- Experience level
- Gender identity
- Sexual orientation
- Disability
- Personal appearance
- Body size
- Race
- Ethnicity
- Age
- Religion
- Nationality

**Expected Behavior:**

‚úÖ Be respectful and considerate
‚úÖ Welcome newcomers warmly
‚úÖ Give and accept constructive feedback gracefully
‚úÖ Focus on what's best for the community
‚úÖ Show empathy towards others

**Unacceptable Behavior:**

‚ùå Harassment or discrimination
‚ùå Trolling or insulting comments
‚ùå Personal or political attacks
‚ùå Publishing others' private information
‚ùå Unprofessional conduct

**Enforcement:**

Violations may result in:
1. Warning
2. Temporary ban
3. Permanent ban

Report violations to: [conduct@cellm.ai](mailto:conduct@cellm.ai)

## Roadmap Influence

**Your voice matters.**

Community feedback directly influences our roadmap:

- Feature requests become priorities
- Bug reports get immediate attention
- Use cases shape development
- Pain points drive improvements

See [ROADMAP.md](../ROADMAP.md) for current plans.
